title: Judge drops 4 of 11 counts against Harvey Weinstein at trial
description: On Tuesday, a Los Angeles judge dismissed two counts of forcible rape and two counts of forcible oral copulation against the former Hollywood producer.

title: Russian missiles hit Poland during strike on Ukraine
description: According to a US official, the barrage hit NATO member Poland, where two people were reportedly killed, and knocked out power in much of Moldova.

title: Islamist killing of Brussels policeman raises questions over procedural failings
description: The assailant, a 32-year-old Belgian-Moroccan ex-convict classified as 'potentially violent', had asked for psychological help on the morning of the attack.

title: US midterms: New York Democrats blamed for national defeat
description: The party lost four representative seats in the state, supposedly one of its strongholds.

title: Faced with a ban, young French bullfighters are defending what they call 'a way of life'
description: On November 24, French MPs will for the first time debate a total ban on bullfighting, and for several weeks apprentice matadors have been rallying to defend their passion.

title: Retail giant Walmart offers $3.1 billion to settle US opioid lawsuit
description: In recent years, opioids have caused around 80,000 deaths a year, in the US. CVS and Walgreen have also recently announced settlements.

title: France to deport 44 migrants of 234 rescued by Ocean Viking, says interior minister
description: The humanitarian vessel disembarked in Toulon on Friday. Not all asylum applications have been processed, meaning more people could still see their claims denied.

title: Macron goes online to win over French youth on climate action
description: The Elysée Palace posted a video of the French president answering questions from young people, whose big concern – the climate – is one they feel he is not prioritizing.

title: Ukraine blames Russia for missile attack on Kyiv housing blocks
description: Strikes hit residential buildings in the heart of Ukraine's capital Tuesday, authorities said.

title: World Cup 2022: The difficulty with estimating the number of deaths on Qatar construction sites
description: The estimate that 6,500 workers have died on World Cup construction sites in Qatar is a number that is quoted often, but the true figure is difficult to ascertain.

title: Tensions rise between Greece and Turkey
description: Washington's tilt in favor of Athens has aggravated the dispute between the two countries, leading to an almost permanent state of alert on the border.

title: French left searches for common position on immigration
description: While the government is preparing a bill on immigration, the four parties of the left-wing NUPES alliance are hesitating on how to balance humanitarian concerns and strong border discourse.

title: Roberto Saviano: 'When you attack a writer, you attack the words you don't want to hear'
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is suing the Gomorrah writer Roberto Saviano for defamation, over comments he made on her migrant policy in 2020.

title: Climate activists throw liquid at Klimt painting in Vienna
description: Two climate activists in Austria attacked a painting by the nineteenth century artist with an unidentified black liquid.

title: A threat to 'human survival:' Decreasing sperm count is a global problem, study finds
description: A study published in the journal Human Reproduction Update says that sperm concentration has more than halved since the beginning of this century, a decrease that is not only accelerating but is also a global issue.

title: Italy unearths exceptional haul of ancient bronzes
description: The discovery of statues depicting deities venerated at a sanctuary in San Casciano dei Bagni in Tuscany is 'unparalleled,' according to the archeologist in charge of the project.

title: French energy minister recused from decisions affecting oil company Perenco
description: Agnès Pannier-Runacher is under investigation from a transparency watchdog because of family ties with the company.

title: Amazon to lay off thousands, looking to save money
description: The number of departures could reach 10,000 – about 3 % of the workforce outside of warehouses, according to press reports.

title: G20 summit: Xi Jinping returns to diplomatic stage seeking dialogue with the West
description: The Chinese president met with US President Joe Biden on Monday for more than three hours, and on Tuesday morning with French President Emmanuel Macron. Next up is the Australian prime minister, for the first time in six years.

title: After Russia's retreat, accounts of torture emerge from Kherson
description: Just days after the southern city of Kherson was liberated, residents there say they were detained, beaten and tortured in the city's prisons, which had been overtaken by Russian soldiers.

title: From midterm results to crypto collapse: Five reasons US stock markets are rebounding
description: Le Monde's New York correspondent Arnaud Leparmentier says it's the beginning of the end of inflation in the US as stock markets rebound. He counts five reasons for the good news.

title: Trump loyalist and election denier Kari Lake loses Arizona governor race
description: Lake's defeat by Democrat Katie Hobbs adds to the list of candidates supported by the former president who failed to get elected in last week's midterms.

title: Coca-Cola, COP27 sponsor and 'world champion' of plastic pollution
description: According to the 2022 Break Free From Plastic's global brand audit, the soda brand is still the one generating the most waste in the environment – a status "incompatible" with the fight against climate change.

title: Docked migrants from the Ocean Viking dream of security, basketball, and 'explanations'
description: The migrants rescued by the Ocean Viking were taken in by France and are staying in a closed vacation center since Saturday. They are waiting to find out if they will be able to apply for asylum.

title: France-UK migration agreement is more of the same, rather than permanent solution
description: In an attempt to stem hazardous "small-boat" migrants crossings of the English Channel, London has pledged to pay Paris 72.2 million euros for the period 2022-2023 to buy drones and finance the deployment of 40% more police and local authorities on the French beaches.
